data.title: Deaths by firearm in Sri Lanka: Lasantha Wickrematunge, Velupillai Prabhakaran, Nadarajah Raviraj, Lakshman Kadirgamar, Taraki Sivaram
data.meta_description: Deaths by firearm in Sri Lanka: Lasantha Wickrematunge, Velupillai Prabhakaran, Nadarajah Raviraj, Lakshman Kadirgamar, Taraki Sivaram by Source: Wikipedia - ISBN 10: 1155176464 - ISBN 13: 9781155176468 - Books LLC, Wiki Series - 2011 - Softcover
data.text:
Reseña del editor:

Please note that the content of this book primarily consists of articles available from Wikipedia or other free sources online. Pages: 28. Chapters: Lasantha Wickrematunge, Velupillai Prabhakaran, Nadarajah Raviraj, Lakshman Kadirgamar, Taraki Sivaram, S. W. R. D. Bandaranaike, Mary Bastian, Lalith Athulathmudali, Rajini Thiranagama, T. Maheswaran, Richard de Zoysa, Selvarajah Rajivarnam, Mylvaganam Nimalrajan, Vijaya Kumaranatunga, Joseph Pararajasingham, Chandra Fernando, Tuan Nizam Muthaliff, Ida Carmelitta, K. Sivanesan, Sinnathamby Sivamaharajah, George Jeyarajasingham, Aiyathurai Nadesan, Sathasivam Baskaran, Relangi Selvarajah, Subramaniyam Sugirdharajan, Premawathie Manamperi, Sampath Lakmal de Silva, Ariyanayagam Chandra Nehru, Chandrabose Suthaharan, P. Devakumaran, Nihal Silva, Suresh Kumar and Ranjith Kumar incident, Sarojini Yogeswaran. Excerpt: Lasantha Manilal Wickrematunge (5 April 1958 - 8 January 2009) was a prominent Sri Lankan high-profile anti-government journalist media personality politician and human rights activist who was assassinated on January 2009. The assassination became even more notable because of a chilling editorial he had written in anticipation of being killed, in which he blames the Sri Lanka government for using assassination to stifle the media: "Murder has become the primary tool whereby the state seeks to control the organs of liberty"Wickrematunge was known for taking "governments of all hues to task", was a "virulent critic of the Mahinda Rajapaksa government", and had been "locked in a legal battle with the president's brother, defence secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa", who was seeking a military solution to the Tamil insurgency. Coming after numerous killings of anti-government and other journalists - e.g. P. Devakumaran (stabbed May 2008), Sampath de Silva (shot April 2006), Taraki Sivaram (abducted near police station, 2005) - the murder of such a prominent journalist and political figure was widely condemned across th...

"About this title" may belong to another edition of this title.
